title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: firecrews tackle major blaze at premises in grantham .
crash leads to closure of a17 .
mobility scooter rider rescued from coastal mudflats .
immingham residents want answers over flooding .
flood sirens tested at grimsby and immingham .
boston park to host two nights of films .

documents.title: chemical fire starts in industrial unit
text: chemical fire starts in industrial unit

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: here are five things we 've learned today :
have a good weekend .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grantham fire : crews still in attendance
text: this is the latest from fire crews at the fire site in tollemache road in grantham this afternoon - there 'll be updates on the incident on bbc radio lincolnshire this evening and tomorrow :
we 're working hard to bring the fire under control at tollemarche road in # grantham .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid in attendance .
my children 's dad works there please is there a number to ring x
hi emma , fire is now out .
there were no injuries reported .
does he have a mobile to contact him on ?
it is going straight to voicemail .
x
can you follow us so we can send you a dm just working on getting you a different phone number to call
following now thank you x
can i say a quick thank you for making sure my husband was able to come home from this .
so a massive thank you for all your hard work xxx
is there a way to contact the people who work there to make sure they are safe x
what was the attendance for the bourne incident please ?

documents.title: weather : dry and warm for the bank holiday weekend
text: i do n't want to jinx it , but the weather is looking pretty good for the weekend .
there could be a few showers overnight tonight , but tomorrow should be mostly dry and bright .
and it 's looking dry and warm , with sunny spells for sunday and monday too .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : video from scene of grantham fire
text: firefighters are still at the scene of a major blaze at an industrial unit in grantham this afternoon and roads in the area are closed .
here 's a video from the scene taken earlier this afternoon :
here 's a video that 's been sent in to us from the scene of the grantham fire - thanks to brittany sparham who sent it in .
i 'm pretty sure that would be specialized chemicals i was there for a month for work experience a couple of years ago

documents.title: 'splendid ' steampunkers hit city
text: 'splendid ' steampunkers hit city

documents.title: grantham fire : road closed at scene of blaze
text: here 's a from the road closure at the grantham fire this afternoon - it 's been sent in by brittany sparham who was in the area this afternoon :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grantham fire : eyewitness from scene
text: these have been sent into us by ben - who is close to the scene of the fire in grantham .
he says he 's heard large bangs from the blaze area - no more official updates from the fire brigade as yet .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grantham fire : road closed
text: we 've just heard from lincolnshire police that a road which runs alongside the fire in grantham has been closed as a precaution .
it 's thought that the blaze involves gas cylinders and other chemicals , meaning officers want to keep motorists away .
the closure 's affecting the b1174 spittlegate level between the town centre and the a1 .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grantham fire : more details
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue tell us 10 fire engines are in attendance at the fire in tollemache road in grantham this afternoon .
it started at around 15.00 according to the brigade .
eyewitnesses say the smoke can be seen from as far away as newark .
they also say they can hear `` loud bangs '' from inside the premises .
here 's a sent in by kirsty reeves , who 's at belton , on the other side of grantham .
st wulfram 's church can be seen in the centre of the
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: major fire in grantham
text: we 're just getting reports of a major fire in grantham - people in the area are being advised to keep windows and doors closed .
here 's the latest from lincolnshire fire and rescue :
we 'll bring you more as we get it .
firefighters are dealing with a fire at a commercial premises on tollemache road in # grantham .
keep windows/doors closed .
updates to follow
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: catastrophe avoided for trapped pet
text: here 's the latest tweet from firefighters in scunthorpe .
although this cat looks uncomfortable , it was cut free :
control : bolt croppers in use by scunthorpe firefighters and the cat-astrophe was avoided .
cat released `` feline '' fine into care of owner .
purrfect result
purrfect !

documents.title: police take to all-terrain vehicles to tackle rural crime
text: lincolnshire 's chief constable bill skelly has been testing his force 's latest purchase today - two quad machines to fight rural crime .
here he is behind the wheel of one of the machines which have 800cc engines and four-wheel drive .
the force says the bikes will help track and detain criminals as police officers use them to tackle even the most challenging terrains at speed .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: steampunk on the streets of lincoln : here 's how they look
text: i 've been out and about with my camera this morning capturing some of the sights of lincoln 's steampunk festival .
tens of thousands of people are expected over the weekend and nearly all of them will be dressed like this :
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : cloud building this afternoon
text: warm with light winds this afternoon but cloud is likely to develop .
it should remain dry .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: a17 crash : more details
text: lincolnshire police have now released a few more details on the crash on the a17 near sutton bridge - which is described as `` very serious '' .
officers say the collision which happened just after 11:00 involved a motorcycle and another vehicle .

a police spokesman said : `` further information will be released as it becomes available but we would advise motorists to prepare for significant disruption and to find an alternative route if possible . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: flood victims in immingham feel they had to 'beg for help '
text: people living on a new housing estate in immingham say they still have n't had an explanation about why their homes flooded .
eight homes on the habrough fields development were flooded following heavy rain earlier this month .
residents say they are angry that nobody has taken responsibility for what happened .
hildy badics ' home was one of those flooded .
she said : `` no-one has been to see how we 've got on or what kind of damage has been done .
it has been left totally down to us .
`` sometimes it felt like you had to beg for help . ''

in a statement anglian water said : `` our investigations show that our sewers were all working and although a foul water pumping station at habrough fields suffered a power outage that night , we do not believe this contributed to the flooding . ''
author: Gemma Dawson
BBC Look North

documents.title: air ambulance called to a17 crash
text: we 've just heard from lincolnshire police about a serious crash on the a17 in south lincolnshire .
officers say they 're having to close the road for quite a long stretch to allow the air ambulance to land at the scene .
it 's happened at the sutton bridge roundabout .
you 're being warned to expect delays on the stretch - which is one of the main routes to the north norfolk coast .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coastguard called out as mobility scooter stranded on coastal mud
text: a man who got stranded after his mobility scooter became stuck in beach mud had to be rescued by a specialist coastguard team .
the team at donna nook was called by a member of the public who found the man in trouble a quarter of mile on to the flats .
posting on facebook , the team said : `` the terrain in the area was wet and muddy so the decision was taken to evacuate them using our rescue vehicle .
`` a group of kind-hearted members of the public who had raised the alarm volunteered to assist by pushing the empty scooter back to sea lane . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: film projectors move in at boston park
text: central park in boston 's being transformed in to an outdoor cinema over the next two nights .
you 'll be able to watch the films mary poppins tonight and des me tomorrow .
it 's being run by town centre services manager christine willoughby - who says she 's hoping for a good turnout .
tickets cost £ 6 for adults , £ 4 for children and £ 18 for a family of two adults and two children .
there 's more details on the website here .

documents.title: watch : your bank holiday weather
text: here 's my forecast for friday and the bank holiday weekend

documents.title: water mains burst causing problems
text: anglian water has apologised to customers in immingham after a water mains burst affected properties across the town .
the company says a large area 's affected - but it hopes to have supplies back to normal by lunchtime .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: steampunks hit lincoln today
text: what 's dubbed as lincoln 's biggest and best ever steampunk festival gets under way today .
it 's expected to attract up to 120,000 people to the city .
visitors dress in late victorian outfits with a sci-fi twist .
the festival starts today and runs across the bank holiday weekend at venues around the city centre .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: sirens to sound in north east lincolnshire
text: do n't be alarmed if you hear the sound of sirens in grimsby and cleethorpes later this morning .
the environment agency is carrying out its annual test of the flood sirens , which were installed 10 years ago .
the 18 sirens are designed to warn more than 25,000 households and businesses of imminent tidal flooding .
they 'll sound at 10:00 and 12:00 .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from the lincolnshire newsroom for today - but we 'll be back with more live updates from 08.00 tomorrow .
there 's just time to look back at five things we 've learned during the day :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : tonight 's weather
text: any showers dying away so a dry night with clear spells .
minimum temperature 11c ( 52f ) .
here 's my full forecast .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: look north tonight
text: join peter tonight for all the latest news from across east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
one tonight at 1830 .
here 's peter with the latest news headlines from bbc look north .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north
text: here 's peter levy with tonight 's headlines on look north :
here 's peter with the latest news headlines from bbc look north .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : accident near lincoln cathedral
text: we 've just had this tweet sent into us - a location to avoid during the rush hour :
accident on nettleham rd outside the lincoln hotel .
no right turn from newport .
police on scene .
@ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: iron age coin hoard declared treasure
text: iron age coin hoard declared treasure

documents.title: police appeal after thieves target work vans
text: police say three streets in grantham were targeted in the early hours of yesterday by thieves who broke into work vans .
the incidents happened on cliffe road , long street , and north parade - and officers say they 're looking for two people who were seen in the area in a white volkswagen golf .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: farm work agency boss 'struggling to get eu workers '
text: a director of a recruitment agency which supplied farm workers to lincolnshire says he 's wondering who will our fruit and vegetables after today 's migration figures were published .
john hardman was speaking on the bbc 's victoria derbsyshire programme after statistics out today showed estimated net migration has fallen by 81,000 - its lowest level for three years .
the figures show that in the year to the end of march there was a significant rise in the number of eu nationals leaving the uk .
mr hardman says brexit means he 's struggling to find employees from the eu .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : child 's play with a purpose
text: but do n't worry their parents were also involved - and nobody was harmed :
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: roman coin hoard 'nationally significant '
text: this pair of coins are among a hoard of almost 300 uncovered on land owned by the university of lincoln .
they were unearthed by metal detectorists sean scargill and hugh jenkins in a field at riseholme on the northern edge of lincoln .
dr adam daubney , finds liaison officer at lincolnshire county council , said : `` the findings offer a fascinating glimpse into a period of history when huge political changes were occurring .
`` we do n't fully understand why the coins were placed into the ground , although this was certainly done deliberately . ''
it could be that they were buried for safekeeping owing to the turbulent times they were living in by an owner who never returned ''
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: let 's face it - thieves will be trying to sell these watches
text: do you recognise any of these watch faces ?
police want you to have a close look at them because they were stolen from a house in scunthorpe and could be offered for sale .
they were taken from winterton road a couple of weeks ago and officers think those responsible will be trying to sell them on .
a nikon camera , other jewellery and cash were also stolen in the raid .
if you have seen them or know anything , call the police on 101 .
or call crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 - a cash reward 's on offer .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : cute kittens move in at city hall
text: this pair of kittens are settling in at city hall in lincoln after workers found them abandoned in a house on a council estate .
they were found at an address on the st giles estate after the residents had moved out .
neighbours say they 'd been feeding them through the letter box .
looks as if they 're ready to set the agenda for today 's council committees :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: flying scotsman will pass through lincolnshire
text: but it will be on a completely different route - meaning people who have spent the morning waiting for it will be disappointed .
the famous locomotive was due to pass through gainsborough , saxilby , metheringham and other stations through to spalding and peterborough this morning .
but it was delayed on it 's departure from york and now the national railway museum - which runs the engine - says it will travel down the east coast main line .
that means it will pass through lincolnshire between newark , through grantham and southwards , but the enthusiasts on the other route will miss it .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man admits causing woman 's death in crash
text: a man has pleaded guilty to causing the death of a 23-year-old woman from lincolnshire in a car crash .
dominique wright was killed after the crash on nottingham road , southwell , in october last year .
today , benjamin hughes , 24 , from nottingham road in lowdham , admitted causing death by careless driving when over the prescribed limit .
he will be sentenced at nottingham crown court on 22 september .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a pleasant afternoon to come
text: sunny periods are likely this afternoon , giving a pleasantly warm feel .
light or moderate winds and a mild night .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: concern over theft of bt jackets
text: you 're being warned to watch out for criminals posing as bt workers after a telephone exchange in lincolnshire was raided by thieves .
four jackets like the one below were stolen when thieves climbed over the fence and broke into two vans at the building on scawby road in brigg overnight on monday .

a police spokesman said : `` we are concerned that these jackets may be used by the thieves to commit further crimes such as bogus calls to homes affecting vulnerable residents who may be duped into thinking they are genuine bt workers . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: people in east marsh 'pulling the community together '
text: people living in the east marsh area of grimsby are coming together for a summer fair today to try and unite the community .
look north has reported on several drugs raids and residents ' concerns about crime and anti-social behaviour .
local people have already taken part in a clean-up of the area .
councillor steve beasant says he hopes the event in grant thorold park will bring some local pride back .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hopes may be dashed for flying scotsman fans
text: we still have n't had official confirmation - but realtime trains which tracks the movments of trains across the country - says the run may be cancelled .
apparently it 's because of a `` problem with the traction equipment '' - i 'm guessing that means the locomotive but i 'm not an expert .
if we get official word from the national railway museum , which runs flying scotsman - we 'll let you know here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: crowds wait in hope for flying scotsman
text: here are some from metheringham , between lincoln and sleaford , where people are waiting to see the famous locomotive .
it 's still not clear if or when it will pass through though .
the national railway museum , which runs the locomotive , is n't responding to requests for information .
good turnout for # flyingscotsman at metheringham .
let 's hope it 's not in vain @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: firefighters called to blaze on train at station
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue had to get on board a train at a station near sleaford last night after a fire broke out in a carriage .
the fire happened at heckington railway station ( above ) yesterday evening .
19:03-crews attending passenger train fire at heckington train station , fire in 1 carriage , being extd by f & r using dry powder extinguisher .
hi , do you know if this fire has been contained ?
hi , do you know if the fire is out ?
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : bus delays warning
text: stagecoach east midlands - which runs bus services in lincoln - says the roadworks in north hykeham will cause problems for its services today :
# lincoln due to the temporary lights at nth hykeham crossroads delays are expected to service 26 & 27 .
allow more time for your journey .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'more training needed ' to drive on rural roads
text: in lincolnshire we 're all too aware of the dangers of rural roads , but a road safety charity says not enough drivers have the skills to drive in the countryside .
jason wakeford , from the road safety charity brake , has told bbc radio lincolnshire more needs to be done to train particularly young drivers on what they need to know .
the government says our roads are among the safest in the world and it 's not practical to make everyone learn to drive on rural roads because of geographical restrictions .
high speeds , sharp bends , narrow lanes , risky overtaking and the presence of vulnerable road users like cyclists , make rural roads the most dangerous by far . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: sunny outlook for wind farm expansion plan
text: you might expect plans to more than double the size of a solar park to go down badly with the neighbours .
but in one village near lincoln , a scheme which would see around 20 acres of panels being set up around an existing solar farm is being welcomed .
people in branston , south of lincoln , say they do n't mind the existing solar farm , and are happy to see the extension , which will increase the area covered by panels by two-and-a-half times .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: flying scotsman still at station
text: i was telling you earlier that flying scotsman 's due in the county this morning .
well , make that this afternoon because it looks like the loco has n't even set off yet .
it was due to leave york more than two hours ago - but we 've been told it 's still at the station .
we 'll keep you informed here , and on bbc radio lincolnshire , on any movements .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: anger as kittens left alone in house after owners moved out
text: animal lovers are furious two pet kittens have been left in a house for days after their owners vacated the property .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: scotsman in steam across the county
text: world famous steam locomotive flying scotsman will be passing through lincolnshire today - on its way down to london .
it 'll pass through gainsborough at around 10.05 .
then it 'll carry on through saxilby , lincoln , metheringham , ruskington and sleaford .
i 'm heading out this morning to try and catch the loco in steam - so check back later to see how i get on !
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: plenty of dry and bright weather across the region today , and we 're off to a dry start to the day .
here 's my full forecast .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: paralysed woman walks in bionic suit
text: paralysed woman walks in bionic suit

documents.title: today 's live coverage
text: that 's all from me and the team here in lincoln today but we 'll be back with more of the very latest from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's @ twitterid with the latest headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: ingoldmells lifeguard : 'even strong swimmers can struggle out there '
text: more now on the two people saved from drowning off ingoldmells beach by lifeguards yesterday .
the pair , a man and an 11-year-old boy , were caught in a rip current whilst swimming near a rocky outcrop .
one of the lifeguards who helped saved them , tom harrop , says it can be a dangerous stretch of sea :
they did n't have much technique and they were just sort of flapping around in the water , really struggling .
even strong swimmers can struggle out there when they get caught by currents like that .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: a fine end to the day , leading to long clear spells allowing some mist or fog patches to form .
later in the night cloud may increase in the west , but it is expected to stay dry .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: electric bikes ready to hire in lincoln
text: you can hire electric bikes in lincoln from today .
since the pedal bike scheme began in 2013 more than 12,000 trips have been made on conventional push bikes .
take a look at the new , nippier version :
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man in hospital after 'scary ' spider attack
text: a skegness dad-of-two ended up in hospital yesterday after a venomous spider attacked him in his home .
author: Skegness Standard

documents.title: gold for wells
text: sophie wells from harby near lincoln has won another gold on the final day of the european para-dressage competition in gothenburg .
she won the freestyle event on her horse fatal attraction .
she 's now won two golds and a silver .
the only question now is where she 's going to put them all !
another gold !
@ sophiewells90 & c fatal attraction top the freestyle to win their third medal this week and gbr 's 8th !
# feieuros2017
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: spalding man suffered 'possible life changing injuries ' in collision
text: more now on the man who was hit by a car on pinchbeck road in spalding this lunchtime .
police say he 's suffered `` possible life-changing injuries '' in the incident .
no-one has been arrested .
pinchbeck road remains shut in both directions between the a151 king 's road and new road .
traffic is heavy in the area .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: changes to bin collections around tour of britain race
text: north lincolnshire council have said that there will be no bin collections on tuesday 5 september , due to the tour of britain cycling race passing through the area .
bins will instead be collected on saturday 9 september , with the exception of the burgundy bin which will be emptied on monday 11 september .
we are suspending waste and recycling collections on tuesday 5 september to help @ twitterid run smoothly
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weatherwatchers : downpour hits part of the county
text: the weather has been pretty unpleasant so far today , grey with a bit of drizzle for most of us .
however some of us have been dealing with something far more dramatic .
take a look at connord98 's back garden after a thunderstorm !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'teletubby ' hills to be remodelled
text: we told you earlier about the `` teletubby hills '' of lincoln 's carlton estate .
the firm who originally were going to level them have been in touch to say the plan is now to remodel them .
following discussions with the local authority and lspeaking to resident linden homes say they recognise the olsen court mounds have become an established and popular feature of the local landscape :
the local authority have now agreed that the mounds can be left in place but simply reduced in height and angle of slope reduced for health and safety and maintenance reasons .
the residents ' representatives are now happy with this .
people power , eh ?
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: thousands respond to livestock market consultation
text: with two weeks to go until the end of consultation on louth livestock market , thousands of people have already had their say .
east lindsey district council 's received more than 2,700 responses to the public consultation so far .
they 're consulting on three options : to build a new market , retain and refurbish the current site , or to try to remove their obligation to hold the market altogether .
the consultation closes on 6 september .
author: Maggie Curtis
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man hit by car in spalding
text: a man has been hit by a car on spalding 's pinchbeck road .
it happened just before 12:30 - the air ambulance is attending the incident .
the road is closed at the junction with new road and kings road and is also affecting traffic on westlode street .
a serious rtc has closed roads in the centre of spalding .
please avoid the area if possible .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: work underway to repair wwii aircraft
text: experts are rebuilding a world war two aircraft in lincolnshire .
the east kirkby aviation centre has added a mosquito fighter bomber to its collection , this is what it looks like :
it 's hoped the `` mossie '' - which at one point was one of the fastest aircraft in the world - will be able to do taxi runs next year .
andrew panton says the team working on her are learning new skills :
we 're used to working with metal aircraft but with this being wood it 's a completely different mindset altogether really - especially when you start looking through the manual !
it 's a world away from a lancaster but it shares a lot of the same systems . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby roof fall man latest
text: a man has been taken to hospital after falling from the roof of a chinese restaurant in grimsby town centre .

an air ambulance landed in cartergate car park at around 09:45 as paramedics attended to the 60-year-old who fell from the roof of the golden regency restaurant , in old market place , onto a flat platform below .
the man , who is associated with the restaurant , was reportedly carrying out repairs at the time of the incident .

emergency services were parked in the car park of the old grange wintringham solicitors building off west st marys gate , with three fire and rescue appliances at the scene along with a hydraulic platform , two ambulances and the air ambulance .
he was lifted down , conscious and breathing , before being taken to diana , princess of wales hospital for further treatment .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lincolnshire hospitals trust chair to step down after 18 months
text: united lincolnshire hospitals nhs trust chair dean fathers has announced that he will be stepping down at the end of october after just over 18 months in the position .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: meeting over woodhall spa developments being held tonight
text: a community meeting 's being held tonight in woodhall spa to discuss a number of controversial planning applications for new houses in the village .
representatives from east lindsey district council are also expected to attend and answer residents ' questions .
it 's being held at 19:00 in coronation hall .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather forecast this lunchtime
text: cloudy and misty at first with long periods of locally heavy rain .
this rain will move northwards allowing drier brighter weather to arrive by around 15:00 bst .
sunny spells developing this afternoon .
mainly light winds .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: woodhall spa baths : plans still being drawn up three years on
text: back in 2014 it was announced the derelict woodhall spa baths , that have stood empty for more than 30 years , were going to be redeveloped and reopened .
however three years on , the building remains the same with no signs of improvement .
the developers , gn construction , are believed to be working alongside other local businesses to get the parking right .
east lindsey district council leader craig leyland says he 's hopeful the £ 4m plan will come off :
it may not be on the scale of a massive spa centre but there will be a spa there , mixed with other uses .
i think it has great potential and will be fantastic to see ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: two saved by lifeguards off ingoldmells beach
text: lifeguards have saved the lives of two men swimming in the sea at ingoldmells yesterday evening .
they were near a rocky outcrop when they got caught up in a rip current and began to struggle .
luckily two lifeguards ( both called tom , saw them and got them back to shore :
one of the swimmers has been taken to hospital for treatment .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : slow on the a46
text: allow some extra time if you 're travelling between newark and lincoln .
traffic is heavy in both directions on the a46 between the b6166 lincoln road turn off and the a616 great north road .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: wells sets sights on dressage glory
text: sophie wells will see if she can add to her medal collection at the european para dressage championships in sweden later .
the harby rider is competing in the freestyle event today .
she 's no stranger to success and has already won an individual silver along with a team gold for great britain in the competition .
lincoln has a gold postbox honouring her wins in the london 2012 paralympic games :
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: paralysed woman buys her own bionic suit
text: a woman from north east lincolnshire who was left paralysed from the waist down following a car accident has raised enough money to buy a bionic suit so she can walk again .
emily storer has spent more than a year trying to raise the money she needed to buy a robotic exoskeleton .
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingemergency crews at grimsby incident
text: there 's a large emergency services presence in grimsby town centre currently as they deal with an ongoing issue .
an air ambulance , fire engines , police cars and paramedics have been reported at the scene near old market place .
we 've contact humberside police who say they 're still trying to find out more about what 's happened .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: the headlines this morning
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: security expert warns skegness could be a terror target as fears grow about provincial towns
text: a security expert says the lincolnshire town could be at risk if terrorists are looking to exploit places with fewer defensive resources than a major city such as london .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: road closures announced for tour of britain stage in north lincolnshire
text: road closures have been announced for stage three of the ovo energy tour of britain in north lincolnshire on tuesday , september 5 .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: big boost for wolds tourism
text: the income from tourism in the lincolnshire wolds has gone up by £ 14m in the last two years .
that 's according to official figures from east lindsey district council who say the visitor economy has increased from £ 153m to £ 167m .
east lindsey district council says efforts and research to boost the profile of the wolds has helped greatly .
i think more people are staying in this country for holidays but i think people are recognising the wolds as an area to visit .
we 're doing lots of work at the moment to promote it to walkers and cyclists .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: deal struck over lincoln 's 'teletubby hills '
text: you may remember that last week we told you about an argument between residents , the council and a developer over the future of the so-called teletubby hills at the carlton estate in lincoln .
linden homes wanted to give the land to the city of lincoln council but they 'd only take it if they could cut the grass - something that would have been quite difficult given the shape of hills .
so the company decided to flatten them - however no one told the residents and when the bulldozers arrived they blocked the entrance with their cars to save the hills .
well after getting together and talking it through they 've come up with a plan , as long as the council approves the developers are going to build some smaller hills for the estate .
sandy mcfarland helped organise the protest , he says its all worked out in the end :
with a bit of compromise and sensible conversation we 've come up with a solution that 's suitable for everyone i think .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: draining experience for lincolnshire firefighters
text: it 's always busy in the evenings for lincolnshire fire and rescue , they 're often racing around the county dealing with everything from fires to cats stuck up trees .
well , yesterday they got a call from the police asking for help to check a drain in lincoln :
a very concerning development as i 'm sure you 'll agree but on further inspection
well , better safe than sorry eh ?
2/2 - this was a false alarm , a duvet was mistaken for a person .
crew used a water rescue sled to recover the duvet and two bicycles .
1/2 - 19:24 - lincoln south assisted @ twitterid in checking the sincil drain , sincil bank , lincoln for a possible person in the drain .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather
text: a mostly cloudy and misty start with outbreaks of thundery rain spreading northeastwards through the morning .
here 's my full forecast .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here , ready to bring you more of the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather updates for you throughout the day , so check back to see what 's new .
is there something we should know about ?
get in touch through email , facebook or twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me and the team today , we 'll be back with more of the very latest from across the country from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: isolated locally heavy , thundery showers will die away this evening .
some sunshine at first , but cloud will increase later with mist and fog forming on higher areas .
intermittent rain is likely later , with heavy showers possible by dawn .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

thousands flocked to the racecourse to watch the riders tear up the track but it looks as though they did n't take everything home with them :

documents.title: lincoln shop owner says customers are being put off by people urinating on her building
text: a lincoln shop-owner has considered quitting the city because of an ongoing problem with people urinating on her building .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: scambassadors hit the road
text: people in part of lincolnshire can get help and advice directly from lincolnshire police and trading standards officers today .

the so-called scambassadors ( you can see what they did there ) have been visiting a number of venues today , including wragby , horncastle and hagworthingham to answer people 's queries and concerns .
lincolnshire 's deputy police and crime comissioner , stuart tweedale is one of the scambassadors .
he says the day of action could reveal even more unreported scams in the area :
people are more comfortable sometimes when you come to them to talk about these things .
people do n't always realise they 're being scammed until they speak about it out loud . ''
we are in our # scam van on route to our community engagement day with @ twitterid @ twitterid venue details :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC reporter, Lincolnshire
